title: Major incident declared after bus overturns ‘trapping up to 20 people’
text:
An air ambulance is currently at the scene but it is not known the extent of passengers’ injuries (Picture: twitter/GCGeraldTaylor)

A major incident has been declared after a double decker bus overturned in Devon, with eyewitness claiming they saw injured passengers trapped.

The incident is believed to have occurred just before 11am on the A385 between Totnes and Paignton.

Emergency services and an air ambulance are currently at the scene.

It is not yet clear how many people have been hurt but one person has sustained serious injuries.

In a statement the force said: ‘A double-decker bus has overturned and a number of passengers have sustained injuries.

‘Currently we believe that one person has sustained serious injuries.

Police have declared a ‘major incident’ (Picture: Twitter/GCGeraldTaylor)

The incident is thought to have occurred just before 11am in south Devon

We also have over a dozen people who have sustained minor injuries and remain at the scene.’

However, an eyewitness said they saw passengers with severe injuries and up to 20 people could have been trapped in the wreckage.

They said: ‘There are many people with very severe injuries. Maybe 20 with some trapped.

‘I was passing and stopped to help but a lot of people too injured to move.’

DCC Paul Netherton tweeted: ‘Major incident declared in South Devon following a major traffic incident – all emergency services working together to respond.’

The force also tweeted: ‘We have just been informed of a major incident following a collision involving a double-decker bus on the A385 between Totnes and Paignton, near to Lombcrombe Cross.

‘Details are still emerging, in the meantime can we please avoid the area. Closures are expected to remain’.

The incident happened on the A385 between Paignton and Totnes (Picture: Twitter/GCGeraldTaylor)

It is not yet known how many have been harmed or the extent of their injuries

A spokesman for Stagecoach South West said: ‘We can confirm one of our buses has been involved in an incident on the A385 between Paignton and Totnes.

‘Emergency services are at the scene. Our immediate thoughts are for those involved and we are helping the emergency services in any way that we can.

‘Safety is our absolute priority and we will be assisting the investigation into the circumstances involved in the incident.’

Traffic website Inrix says: ‘A385 Totnes Road closed in both directions.

‘Slow traffic due to overturned double decker bus between Southfield (Paignton) and Saxon Meadow (Totnes).’
